titleStmt.title: The young-mans complaint, or, An answer to the damosels tragedy. When friends deny, and won't comply, but let them suffer smart, we often see such cruelty, will break a lovers heart. To the tune of, Charon, &c. This may be printed, R.P.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Back, at the black boy on London-bridge, near the draw-bridge,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Now for the loss of my amorous jewel ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the black boy on London-bridge, near the draw-bridge
